website_summaries.verdict: D-Link's newest pre-draft 802.11ac router, the Wireless AC1750 Dual Band Gigabit Cloud Router (DIR-868L) does not deliver performance as powerful as some competing routers, but it's an improvement over D-Link's previous 11ac router.

customer_reviews.title: Well-featured, good value, dd-wrt
customer_reviews.text: For fifty quid this is a good cable router. Well featured, aesthetically please (as far as routers go), can run did-wrt ( with an easy restore method for when you brick it) and VPN. I’m using it as an access point behind my ISP’s router. Range is good, at least better than my Orange router. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stampy

customer_reviews.title: Very cool Finally, this does 'beam forming' which is worth ...
customer_reviews.text: Significantly boosted not only my range and speed (compared to previous Netgear N type), but more importantly some of my devices (laptop, phone, ipads) that can use the 5ghz spectrum can access this with nearly no local interference whilst simultaneously my older devices continue to access the 2.4Ghz range, on this same router. Very cool Finally, this does 'beam forming' which is worth paying the extra compared to the cheaper variant. Easily the best value router i've ever bought. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.text: Virgin is my broadband provider their superhub 1 and 2 wireless is so bad I had to look for an alternative I bought this dlink . I'm using the suprhub in modem mode now and dlink as my wireless router the difference is amazing my smart tv works in the bedroom speed tests are the same all over the house . I've wasted money on network adapters moved my old router around the house complained to virgin for hours on the phone this dlink router is £80 well spent it has solved all my connection and streaming problems
customer_reviews.author: rab-mo

customer_reviews.title: Does what I'm asking of it sofar
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to future proof the house but at the moment the tablet, TV, PC and phones are all wireless n. Easy to setup and all devices see each other. A Draytek Vigor 120 currently supplies our Broadband via an ADSL line splitter and all works well. Line speed about 2Mbs. Hopefully when I upgrade a device to AC everything will still work. All in all no complaints or problems.
customer_reviews.author: G. P. Shedden

customer_reviews.title: I assume this is not a general issue and was just a one-off fault but from an aesthetic viewpoint the case is too shiny/plastic
customer_reviews.text: Only used the web interface to configure where it refused to connect to my fibre service (Plusnet) via the BT modem. My backup (non-wireless) Draytek router connected immediately the cable was switched over. I assume this is not a general issue and was just a one-off fault but from an aesthetic viewpoint the case is too shiny/plastic to live in my lounge where I would have liked to place it. I will wait for the Netgear Orbi to surface before venturing into this market again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Having just moved in to my first home I wanted the best internet I could get
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade from the standard Hyperoptic router - wow, what a difference. Having just moved in to my first home I wanted the best internet I could get, so I went with Hyperoptic. After a week of terrible speeds 2-10mb down and up (I went with the 100mb up & down), I decided to see if the router was the problem and bought this. Setup was super easy, plugged straight in and it worked right from the off, from getting speeds of up to 10meg with the Hyperoptic router and poor WiFi signal, I went up to 150mb down and up, brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: MR F.

customer_reviews.title: Has good range and 5GHz support
customer_reviews.text: Works as a charm, no problem at all. I have a Virgin Superhub which couldn't handle the internet, the wifi and the ethernet network at the same time, dropped connection and rebooted countless times - I've bought this d-link router and no problems since. Has good range and 5GHz support. Menu is easy to manage, setup isn't complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Szabi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router (but not modem)
customer_reviews.text: Performs well and extends wifi nicely when connected to a powerline adaptor. I bought mine as a replacement for Plusnet Modem/Router but it wont do that - you still need a modem. I would return except if makes an excellent wifi booster/extender.
customer_reviews.author: Spezzer

customer_reviews.title: Good range, good speed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for an Asus router that I finally lost patience with where it was beginning to be almost impossible to connect to the 2.4G band (problem as all but one device connect on that band). After doing some research I went for this & crossed my fingers. Setup took a couple of minutes, didn't even need my PC, downloaded the app on my tablet, typed in my user name & password, & hey presto, all set up. Good range, good speed, can't really fault it so far, highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: No better than anything else. Could not connect in bedroom only 8m away. (+chimney 1m of blockwork)
customer_reviews.author: Microchips

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Wireless AC1750 Dual-Band Gigabit Cloud Router
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and gives good signal throughout our house which has solid brick walls. I needed a bit of telephone support from the manufactureer and they were very helpful. Its a bit on the large size hence only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: David B Collins

customer_reviews.title: Best router i've owned for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I have been through many routers and most struggle giving you open NATs on multiple consoles at the same time. This is the only router I have owned that has given me a consistently open NAT on my xbox 360, xbox one, ps3 and ps4. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great delivery and product easy to set up and use. Strong signal indeed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: I've had this over two years and it's performed flawlessly. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Chapman

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup really powerful
customer_reviews.text: easy to setup, really powerful, long range, stylish, plenty of remote connections, nice not to have loads of flickering lights to distract super fast.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good product, emits a strong 5GHz signal that can ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, emits a strong 5GHz signal that can be found throughout both upstairs and downstairs with an easy to access UI and easy to set-up wizard. Is also great at reconfiguring after any necessary resets.
customer_reviews.author: nathanolly

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: As the time passed, too many 802.11n routers were appearing around my house and my old Belkin started to have problems in keeping the wifi connection. This come to solve my problem. No more issues about it. The wifi connection is always on.
customer_reviews.author: Tecla

customer_reviews.title: really good. I am using it with my Virgin Superhub ...
customer_reviews.text: really good. I am using it with my Virgin Superhub which was ok but not at all reliable for WiFi. This is just briliant
customer_reviews.author: stephen catton

customer_reviews.title: It was delivered quickly and in good condition but the product itself is unreliable and had ...
customer_reviews.text: Dissapointing. It was delivered quickly and in good condition but the product itself is unreliable and had many issues with config.
customer_reviews.author: Raystlin

customer_reviews.title: Wifi signal range was very poor.
customer_reviews.text: Wifi signal range was very poor, given this is supposed to be premium with top performance. It worked great in the room, but signal dropped to -80dBm in a room or two away (through brick walls).
customer_reviews.author: Slider

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great router good range the same one cost £150 in Argos
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: + Good range, high speed, ac and 5GHz dual band, network accessible USB drive,looks nice - Not easily wall mountable so a shelf might be necessary
customer_reviews.author: Zimmy

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Router
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up an configure and unlike my previous router, it doesn't need a restart a day. Also a good 30m broadcast radius through a house with lots of metal in the walls. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great unit but poor coverage
customer_reviews.text: Great bit of kit but coverage isnt all it could be.
customer_reviews.author: Si

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing wireless range.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a previous D-Link router, This router operates functionally as expected, but does not have any greater wireless range than it's less sophisticated predecessor, which is not very far.
customer_reviews.author: Strudders

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wireless speeds are great! I was hoping for more configuration options.
customer_reviews.author: Patryk

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Range not long enough for my home. My much cheaper Belkin 54g modem router had a longer range.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Spence

customer_reviews.title: Unusul design but works very well indeed...
customer_reviews.text: Bought in a sale and noticed a much improved performance in my PC, mobile and Tablet experiences. A little pricey but does the job well. Easy to setup and works a treat. If you are using the device list feature, then reboot the machine after you have listed all the devices that can access your network. If I were to be a bit pedantic, can we have this in white and does it really have to be that large? I now try an hide the black phallic looking router behind some larger family photos in order to make the living room more presentable.
customer_reviews.author: JoLim

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless replacement for the awful BT hub.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for the awful wireless performance of the BT Infinity hub modem/router. The BT wireless signal kept dropping out and was not powerful enough to get around our house consistently. Before the BT hub I had Netgear and Asus wireless routers and they were fine. I only went to BT because of Infinity. This D-link unit is just a wireless router and it performs perfectly. Not one dropout and it's fast everywhere in the house. I just turned off the BT wireless, changed the DCHP address and it just works. And it's much less intrusive than the ultra-futuristic Netgear unit that is also meant to be good.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be an improvement on my D-Link DIR-655 with the added 5Ghz band. How wrong I was! It's obviously build down to a price and was hopeless, collapsing under load with 6 devices on wi-fi and linked to a 30Mbps cable modem. Erratic throughput, 2.4Ghz wireless drops out, the web-based admin console 'freezing' etc. All the symptoms of underpowered CPU and insufficient RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Emteq

customer_reviews.title: Good customer communication
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service with the issue I had would recommend
customer_reviews.author: trevor h

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and works great. Works well for gaming online with on strict or moderate nat problems any more.
customer_reviews.author: S Mc

customer_reviews.title: Not much in the way of useful tools. Bridging would be nice
customer_reviews.text: Not much in the way of useful tools. Bridging would be nice. I bought originally as I mistook for DIR 868L A1 which does have bridging. 868L B1 doesn't. Senseless removal of a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: This performs no better than the 802
customer_reviews.text: I paid a substantial amount for an 802.11ac router. This performs no better than the 802.11a/b/g/n router my phone supplier gave me. It works but it has no additional boosted performance that it advertises. Mine is on the ceiling in the centre upstairs and is supposed to cover my whole house. It barely covers the first floor.
customer_reviews.author: David Tickner

customer_reviews.title: 802.11 ac speed at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: But range limited and not as good in that regard as my existing dual band n router I use a wifi repeater to extend the signal across the house. But with this router the extender was struggling to maintain its connection to the router. Returned to amazon for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Rugaboo

customer_reviews.title: the router itsellf is very good but has issues with Apple Airplay
customer_reviews.text: the router itsellf is very good but has issues with Apple Airplay, it would not allow me to stream to amo or apple tv sent back for refund
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Very fast but kept getting a virus that would redirect ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fast but kept getting a virus that would redirect our online browsing to competitions. Even on the ipad. After changing back to the BT Home Hub we are virus free again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor service, faulty product.
customer_reviews.text: This product went faulty after 10 months. The 2.4 MHz channel stopped working. I wrote to the supplier Avides who wanted to repair it taking 6 weeks, plus the travel time of posting it back to them then them posting it back to me. So the choice is:- return it and have no internet for 8 weeks?? Or go and buy another one. I think I will buy another one but not from them. I would expect a product to last longer than 12 months and something like a router that is a fundamental part in accessing the internet to be replaced more quickly.
customer_reviews.author: opolopo

product_meta.title: D-Link DIR-868L/B Wireless AC1750 Dual-Band Gigabit Cloud Router
product_meta.description:
D-Link DIR-868L/B Wireless AC1750 Dual-Band Gigabit Cloud Router

BOX CONTAINS


 * D-Link Wireless AC1750 Dual-Band Gigabit Cloud Router
feature_bullets: The DIR-868L uses the latest Wireless AC technology, which can provide transfer rates of up to 1.3 Gbps
Complete control by allowing you to monitor who is connecting to your network
File Sharing Right at Your Fingertips
Easy to Set Up and Use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars229 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
